questions.text: Khan Abdul Ghaffar Khan was also known as:
questions.explanation: Khan Abdul Ghaffar Khan was known as Bacha Khan and also as the Frontier Gandhi.

questions.text: The Khudai Khidmatgar movement was started by:
questions.explanation: The Khudai Khidmatgar (Servants of God) movement was started by Khan Abdul Ghaffar Khan.

questions.text: The 1946 referendum in NWFP resulted in favor of:
questions.explanation: The 1947 referendum in NWFP resulted in 99.02% votes in favor of joining Pakistan.

questions.text: Who was the first Chief Minister of NWFP after independence?
questions.explanation: Khan Abdul Qayyum Khan was the first Chief Minister of NWFP after Pakistan's independence.
Pakistan became independent on August 14, 1947, a day before India's independence.

questions.text: Who was the first Governor-General of Pakistan?
questions.explanation: Quaid-e-Azam Muhammad Ali Jinnah was the first Governor-General of Pakistan.

questions.text: The Radcliffe Award was announced on:
questions.explanation: The Radcliffe Award, determining the India-Pakistan border, was announced on August 17, 1947.
Quaid-e-Azam Muhammad Ali Jinnah died on September 11, 1948, in Karachi.

questions.text: The First Constituent Assembly of Pakistan met on:
questions.explanation: The First Constituent Assembly of Pakistan met on August 11, 1947, in Karachi.

questions.text: Which province acceded to Pakistan through its ruler's decision?
questions.explanation: Balochistan (Kalat State) acceded to Pakistan in March 1948 through the Khan of Kalat's decision.
